newsitem.title: USA: WSCC approves 6,900 MW summer rating for Intertie.
newsitem.headline: WSCC approves 6,900 MW summer rating for Intertie.

text.p: The board of the Western Systems Coordinating Council (WSCC) approved Wednesday a final summertime capacity for the Pacific Intertie of 6,900 megawatts (MW), a spokeswoman for the reliability council said.
The new rating will replace an interim summer cap of 6,300 MW which has been in place since July 1.
The increase to 6,900 MW will likely go into effect early next week, when necessary system operating procedures are finalized, the spokeswoman noted.
The summer rating will be effective through September 30, or until seasonal conditions for the regional electricity grid no longer match conditions included in the summer plan.

Operation of the 7,900 MW interstate power transmission system has been limited by various degrees over the past year amid reliability concerns following two major power outages in the summer of 1996.
